element.name: Maretimo by toczygroszek, Traditional Cache (1.5/2.5)

long-description.p:
Around 1770 on the coast of Blackrock a house was built with fine rococo features in mini-demesne with a large garden. The owner was Nicholas Lawless, Lord Cloncurry. When the Railway company started to build the railway line in 1830s, Lord Cloncurry of Maretimo and Sir Harcourt Lees of Blackrock House (the Blackrock House was nearby) declined to build a railway line through their lands. Finally, the Railway company gave them large compensation, private harbor, and few buildings, which were built for them. It was the Cloncurry Towers bridge, granite bridge over the railway and doric bathing-temple. Towers and bridge still exist, but bathing-temple was demolished in 2004. Now you can find ruins of this structure, and broken pillars on the bottom of the sea nearby. Maretimo house was demolished in 1970’s.
Unfortunately, there is no easy access to Maretimo grounds. There is one small footbridge, but is accessible only for residents Maretimo housing estate. Anyway, there are two other ways. One route starts nearby Blacrock DART station at coordinates N53 18.140 W6 10.651 where there is a car park too, and the second route at coordinates N53 17.888 W6 09.625 on a small harbor in Seapoint (where you can find parking space as well), not far from DART station. Both ways require walking on the sea-shore, and you have to come during the low tide. You can check tides HERE.
The cache is small tupperware container with some goodies. Be careful, because sometimes this area can be muggled, especially at sunny weekends.

element.additional-waypoints:
BF1FV3E - Blackrock footbridge
N 53° 18.140 W 006° 10.651
SH1FV3E - Seapoint harbor
N 53° 17.888 W 006° 09.625

ul.li:
2010-06-13T10:50:41Z : Found it by Simotaniously
Excellend adventure. Very difficult but loved it.

2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Found it by BlueFoxPL
Another great day for caching... found with some friends. TFTC.

2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Found it by Wicca Cailín
This was a tough one. Walking on walls, sliding on slimmy rocks walking on the wall beside the dart track. To come to a big wall that you had to pull yourself up onto!!! Definately the less attractive route from Blackrock dart station! TFTC.

2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Found it by colmyster
Where do I start with this one. Firstly we came at it from the north so we had to scale alot of walls and rocks which is not recommended. Then when we finally got to the cache we tried to get back to the road from the oppisite direction but we came across a couple who where, well, lets just say they where having a very active romantic evening !! So back over the dangerous rocks it was for us....
TFTC
In: CIE travel bug & dinosaur Out: San Diego travel bug (which was not activated yet so whoever owns it please let me know if they want to or should I do it for them ???) & Gonzo

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Maretimo
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Around 1770 on the coast of Blackrock a house was built with fine rococo features in mini-demesne with a large garden. The owner was Nicholas Lawless, Lord Cloncurry. When the Railway company started to build the railway line in 1830s, Lord Cloncurry of Maretimo and Sir Harcourt Lees of Blackrock House (the Blackrock House was nearby) declined to build a railway line through their lands. Finally, the Railway company gave them large compensation, private harbor, and few buildings, which were built for them. It was the Cloncurry Towers bridge, granite bridge over the railway and doric bathing-temple. Towers and bridge still exist, but bathing-temple was demolished in 2004. Now you can find ruins of this structure, and broken pillars on the bottom of the sea nearby. Maretimo house was demolished in 1970’s.

Unfortunately, there is no easy access to Maretimo grounds. There is one small footbridge, but is accessible only for residents Maretimo housing estate. Anyway, there are two other ways. One route starts nearby Blacrock DART station at coordinates N53 18.140 W6 10.651 where there is a car park too, and the second route at coordinates N53 17.888 W6 09.625 on a small harbor in Seapoint (where you can find parking space as well), not far from DART station. Both ways require walking on the sea-shore, and you have to come during the low tide. You can check tides HERE.

The cache is small tupperware container with some goodies. Be careful, because sometimes this area can be muggled, especially at sunny weekends.





Additional Waypoints

BF1FV3E - Blackrock footbridge
N 53° 18.140 W 006° 10.651

SH1FV3E - Seapoint harbor
N 53° 17.888 W 006° 09.625
